channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: The Stable Artist: Steering Semantics in Diffusion Latent Space
item.description: Large, text-conditioned generative diffusion models have recently gained a lot of attention for their impressive performance in generating high-fidelity images from text alone.

item.title: MegaCRN: Meta-Graph Convolutional Recurrent Network for Spatio-Temporal Modeling
item.description: Spatio-temporal modeling as a canonical task of multivariate time series forecasting has been a significant research topic in AI community.

item.title: Parameter-Efficient Finetuning of Transformers for Source Code
item.description: Pretrained Transformers achieve state-of-the-art performance in various code-processing tasks but may be too large to be deployed.

item.title: Reinforcement Learning and Tree Search Methods for the Unit Commitment Problem
item.description: When generator outages are considered, guided tree search saves over 2\% in operating costs as compared with methods using conventional $N-x$ reserve criteria.

item.title: Hardware-efficient learning of quantum many-body states
item.description: Efficient characterization of highly entangled multi-particle systems is an outstanding challenge in quantum science.

item.title: Multi-Dimensional Self Attention based Approach for Remaining Useful Life Estimation
item.description: We investigated the mainstream RUL prediction models and summarized the basic steps of RUL prediction modeling in this scenario.

item.title: Instrumental Variables in Causal Inference and Machine Learning: A Survey
item.description: This paper serves as the first effort to systematically and comprehensively introduce and discuss the IV methods and their applications in both causal inference and machine learning.

item.title: Reasoning over Different Types of Knowledge Graphs: Static, Temporal and Multi-Modal
item.description: The early works in this domain mainly focus on static KGR and tend to directly apply general knowledge graph embedding models to the reasoning task.

item.title: PyPop7: A Pure-Python Library for Population-Based Black-Box Optimization
item.description: In this paper, we present a pure-Python open-source library, called PyPop7, for black-box optimization (BBO).

item.title: Analysis of Thai Capital Market Linkages: Part II. Bivariate Copula vs. Granger Causality, a Centrality Analysis
item.description: Analytically thorough understanding of financial-market dynamics is fundamental to the promotion of capital-market innovation, efficiency, and resilience; innovative, efficient, and resilient capital market, in turn, is fundamental to the sustainable economic development of the nation and the robust financial stability of its economy.

item.title: Graph algorithms for predicting subcellular localization at the pathway level
item.description: Protein subcellular localization is an important factor in normal cellular processes and disease.

item.title: Resolving Semantic Confusions for Improved Zero-Shot Detection
item.description: Zero-shot detection (ZSD) is a challenging task where we aim to recognize and localize objects simultaneously, even when our model has not been trained with visual samples of a few target ("unseen") classes.

item.title: NMS Strikes Back
item.description: Our detector that trains Deformable-DETR with traditional IoU-based label assignment achieved 50. 2 COCO mAP within 12 epochs (1x schedule) with ResNet50 backbone, outperforming all existing traditional or transformer-based detectors in this setting.

item.title: Video Prediction by Efficient Transformers
item.description: Video prediction is a challenging computer vision task that has a wide range of applications.

item.title: ALSO: Automotive Lidar Self-supervision by Occupancy estimation
item.description: The core idea is to train the model on a pretext task which is the reconstruction of the surface on which the 3D points are sampled, and to use the underlying latent vectors as input to the perception head.

item.title: REAP: A Large-Scale Realistic Adversarial Patch Benchmark
item.description: In this work, we propose the REAP (REalistic Adversarial Patch) benchmark, a digital benchmark that allows the user to evaluate patch attacks on real images, and under real-world conditions.

item.title: Masked autoencoders is an effective solution to transformer data-hungry
item.description: This results in ViT not performing as well as CNNs on small datasets like medicine and science.

item.title: HOTCOLD Block: Fooling Thermal Infrared Detectors with a Novel Wearable Design
item.description: Adversarial attacks on thermal infrared imaging expose the risk of related applications.

item.title: Tensor-based Sequential Learning via Hankel Matrix Representation for Next Item Recommendations
item.description: Self-attentive transformer models have recently been shown to solve the next item recommendation task very efficiently.

item.title: Is ProtoPNet Really Explainable? Evaluating and Improving the Interpretability of Prototypes
item.description: ProtoPNet and its follow-up variants (ProtoPNets) have attracted broad research interest for their intrinsic interpretability from prototypes and comparable accuracy to non-interpretable counterparts.

item.title: MoDem: Accelerating Visual Model-Based Reinforcement Learning with Demonstrations
item.description: We identify key ingredients for leveraging demonstrations in model learning -- policy pretraining, targeted exploration, and oversampling of demonstration data -- which forms the three phases of our model-based RL framework.

item.title: SRoUDA: Meta Self-training for Robust Unsupervised Domain Adaptation
item.description: In this paper, we present a new meta self-training pipeline, named SRoUDA, for improving adversarial robustness of UDA models.

item.title: RPN: A Word Vector Level Data Augmentation Algorithm in Deep Learning for Language Understanding
item.description: In subsequent experiments, we found that adding RPN to the training or fine-tuning model resulted in a stable boost on all 8 natural language processing tasks, including TweetEval, CoLA, and SST-2 datasets, and more significant improvements than other data augmentation algorithms. The RPN algorithm applies to all sentence-level tasks for language understanding and is used in any deep learning model with a word embedding layer.

item.title: Collaborating Heterogeneous Natural Language Processing Tasks via Federated Learning
item.description: In this study, we further broaden the application scope of FL in NLP by proposing an Assign-Then-Contrast (denoted as ATC) framework, which enables clients with heterogeneous NLP tasks to construct an FL course and learn useful knowledge from each other.

item.title: In Defense of Cross-Encoders for Zero-Shot Retrieval
item.description: We find that the number of parameters and early query-document interactions of cross-encoders play a significant role in the generalization ability of retrieval models.

item.title: Untargeted Attack against Federated Recommendation Systems via Poisonous Item Embeddings and the Defense
item.description: Experiments on two public datasets show that ClusterAttack can effectively degrade the performance of FedRec systems while circumventing many defense methods, and UNION can improve the resistance of the system against various untargeted attacks, including our ClusterAttack.

item.title: Feature-Level Debiased Natural Language Understanding
item.description: We also verify that DCT can reduce biased latent features from the model's representations.

item.title: Mul-GAD: a semi-supervised graph anomaly detection framework via aggregating multi-view information
item.description: For a more comprehensive conclusion, we further investigate the effect of the objective function and the number of fused views on detection performance.

item.title: Transductive Linear Probing: A Novel Framework for Few-Shot Node Classification
item.description: More recently, inspired by the development of graph self-supervised learning, transferring pretrained node embeddings for few-shot node classification could be a promising alternative to meta-learning but remains unexposed.

item.title: Random Feature Models for Learning Interacting Dynamical Systems
item.description: Particle dynamics and multi-agent systems provide accurate dynamical models for studying and forecasting the behavior of complex interacting systems.

item.title: Orthogonal SVD Covariance Conditioning and Latent Disentanglement
item.description: Extensive experiments on visual recognition demonstrate that our methods can simultaneously improve covariance conditioning and generalization.

item.title: Learning Neural Volumetric Field for Point Cloud Geometry Compression
item.description: The neural field representation of the point cloud includes the network parameters and all the latent codes, which are generated by using back-propagation over the network parameters and its input.

item.title: DISCO: Adversarial Defense with Local Implicit Functions
item.description: The problem of adversarial defenses for image classification, where the goal is to robustify a classifier against adversarial examples, is considered.

item.title: ezDPS: An Efficient and Zero-Knowledge Machine Learning Inference Pipeline
item.description: Machine Learning as a service (MLaaS) permits resource-limited clients to access powerful data analytics services ubiquitously.

item.title: Associations Between Natural Language Processing (NLP) Enriched Social Determinants of Health and Suicide Death among US Veterans
item.description: All SDOH, measured by structured data and NLP, were significantly associated with increased risk of suicide.

item.title: FastClass: A Time-Efficient Approach to Weakly-Supervised Text Classification
item.description: Weakly-supervised text classification aims to train a classifier using only class descriptions and unlabeled data.

item.title: NeuS2: Fast Learning of Neural Implicit Surfaces for Multi-view Reconstruction
item.description: To accelerate the training process, we integrate multi-resolution hash encodings into a neural surface representation and implement our whole algorithm in CUDA.

item.title: Towards Scale Balanced 6-DoF Grasp Detection in Cluttered Scenes
item.description: Moreover, a Scale Balanced Learning (SBL) loss and an Object Balanced Sampling (OBS) strategy are designed, where SBL enlarges the gradients of the samples whose scales are in low frequency by apriori weights while OBS captures more points on small-scale objects with the help of an auxiliary segmentation network.

item.title: Targeted Adversarial Attacks on Deep Reinforcement Learning Policies via Model Checking
item.description: We use this metric to craft optimal adversarial attacks.

item.title: A Unified Knowledge Graph Service for Developing Domain Language Models in AI Software
item.description: By enhancing the task-specific training procedure with domain knowledge graphs, we propose KnowledgeDA, a unified and low-code domain language model development service.

item.title: An approach to robust ICP initialization
item.description: In this note, we propose an approach for initializing the Iterative Closest Point (ICP) algorithm that allows us to apply ICP to unlabelled point clouds that are related by rigid transformations.

item.title: A soft nearest-neighbor framework for continual semi-supervised learning
item.description: Despite significant advances, the performance of state-of-the-art continual learning approaches hinges on the unrealistic scenario of fully labeled data.

item.title: A Whac-A-Mole Dilemma: Shortcuts Come in Multiples Where Mitigating One Amplifies Others
item.description: Key to advancing the reliability of vision systems is understanding whether existing methods can overcome multiple shortcuts or struggle in a Whac-A-Mole game, i. e., where mitigating one shortcut amplifies reliance on others.

item.title: An Attention-based Multi-Scale Feature Learning Network for Multimodal Medical Image Fusion
item.description: Furthermore, we propose a novel fixed fusion strategy termed Softmax-based weighted strategy based on the Softmax weights and matrix nuclear norm.

item.title: Weakly Supervised Semantic Segmentation for Large-Scale Point Cloud
item.description: Firstly, we construct a pretext task, \textit{i. e.,} point cloud colorization, with a self-supervised learning to transfer the learned prior knowledge from a large amount of unlabeled point cloud to a weakly supervised network.

item.title: A Grid-based Sensor Floor Platform for Robot Localization using Machine Learning
item.description: Sensor Floor consists of 345 nodes installed across the floor of our logistic research hall with dual-band RF and Inertial Measurement Unit (IMU) sensors.

item.title: Training-Free Structured Diffusion Guidance for Compositional Text-to-Image Synthesis
item.description: In this work, we improve the compositional skills of T2I models, specifically more accurate attribute binding and better image compositions.

item.title: Expeditious Saliency-guided Mix-up through Random Gradient Thresholding
item.description: Mix-up training approaches have proven to be effective in improving the generalization ability of Deep Neural Networks.

item.title: Networked Restless Bandits with Positive Externalities
item.description: Restless multi-armed bandits are often used to model budget-constrained resource allocation tasks where receipt of the resource is associated with an increased probability of a favorable state transition.

item.title: Doubly Robust Kernel Statistics for Testing Distributional Treatment Effects Even Under One Sided Overlap
item.description: In this work we focus on the problem of testing for causal effects that manifest in a difference in distribution for treatment and control.
